bibl.title: Imagining Egypt from Lucan to Philostratus
bibl.note: Part I. Setting the Scene: 1. Egypt and the Nile in Julio-Claudian Rome. - Part II. Lucan: 2. Pompey's Nile; - 3. Beyond Pompey's Nile; - 4. The Nile Digression. - Part III. Flavian Rome: 5. Egypt and the Nile in Flavian Rome; - 6. Valerius Flaccus' Argonautica; - 7. Statius' Thebaid; - 8. Statius' Propempticon (Silu. 3.2). - Part IV. The Antonine and Severan Periods: 9. The Nile and Egypt in the Antonine and Severan Periods; - 10. Plutarch's On Isis and Osiris; - 11. Philostratus' Life of Apollonius of Tyana. - Conclusions. - Afterword. Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: Eleni Manolaraki, Noscendi Nilum Cupido. Imagining Egypt from Lucan to Philostratus = Trends in Classics. Supplementary Volumes. 18.
Berlin - New York, W. de Gruyter, 2012, 8°, x-382 pp. ISBN 978-3-11-029773-7. €109,95.

Part I. Setting the Scene: 1. Egypt and the Nile in Julio-Claudian Rome. - Part II. Lucan: 2. Pompey's Nile; - 3. Beyond Pompey's Nile; - 4. The Nile Digression. - Part III. Flavian Rome: 5. Egypt and the Nile in Flavian Rome; - 6. Valerius Flaccus' Argonautica; - 7. Statius' Thebaid; - 8. Statius' Propempticon (Silu. 3.2). - Part IV. The Antonine and Severan Periods: 9. The Nile and Egypt in the Antonine and Severan Periods; - 10. Plutarch's On Isis and Osiris; - 11. Philostratus' Life of Apollonius of Tyana. - Conclusions. - Afterword. Bibliography. Index.
C.R. par Nick West, BMCRev < http://bmcr.brynmawr.edu/2013/2013-08-05.html >. - Gareth Williams, Gnomon 88 (2016) pp. 267-270.
